instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message:
Hi,
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no power.
I once fixed the <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> lines.
UB300 and UB400
with battery:
-restarts the ammeter on all USB
-Now on 2 usb ports (UB300 and UB400) I have 20v. Present <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL>.
-On 3100 and 3200 I have 5v. <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL> is missing on both.
Without batteries, there is 5v everywhere
- restarts the ammeter on all USB
-  <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL> have 0.53 in Diode-Mode

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message:
There must be a problem on <CHIP>U3100</CHIP>/200 area.
Bad component, or <CHIP>U2890</CHIP> corrupted.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message:
sorry correction 
UB300 and UB400
with battery:
-Now on 2 usb ports (UB300 and UB400) I have 20v but restarts the ammeter . 
-On 3100 and 3200 I have 0v. 
Without batteries, there is 5v everywhere
- UB300 and UB400 Present <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL>  but restarts the ammeter. 
- <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> no <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL> and no restarts 
-  <SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC</SIGNAL> have 0.53 in Diode-Mode

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message:
"On 3100 and 3200 I have 0v"
Do you mean 0V on USB-C meter?
It shows 0V, no black screen?

Compare diode mode readings between J3300 and JB500.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message: I mean 00.00 on the display -  I use by-3200. When I connect battery appears 5v.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message:
Don't you have the classic USB-C meter?
I don't understand what the people see on that blue bulshit.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5/20v
threads.message: I replaced 2x CD3215s and I have 20v. Does this board boot without batteries ?
